description: Fed announces $600B purchase of agency MBS and GSE debt
FOMC expands QE1 to $1.75T total; adds $300B Treasury purchases
FOMC announces $600B Treasury purchase programme
Open-ended MBS purchases at $40B/month ('QE infinity')
QE3 expanded; adds $45B/month in Treasuries ($85B/month total)
Bernanke congressional testimony signals possibility of tapering
FOMC announces $10B/month tapering of asset purchases
FOMC ends asset purchase programme; final taper
Emergency $700B purchase programme (MBS + Treasuries)
Fed announces unlimited asset purchases (QE infinity II)
Emergency Securities Markets Programme for peripheral sovereign bonds
Draghi London speech: will do 'whatever it takes' to preserve euro
ECB announces unlimited conditional sovereign bond purchases (OMT)
ECB launches €60B/month expanded asset purchase programme
APP expanded to €80B/month; adds corporate bond purchases (CSPP)
APP restarted at €20B/month open-ended; deposit rate cut to -0.5%
ECB announces €750B Pandemic Emergency Purchase Programme
PEPP envelope expanded by €600B to €1350B total
BoJ launches Quantitative and Qualitative Easing: ¥60-70T/year asset purchases
BoJ doubles QQE pace to ¥80T/year ('Halloween surprise')
BoJ adopts negative interest rates (-0.1%) alongside QQE
BoJ introduces yield curve control; 10Y JGB yield target ~0%
BoJ widens YCC band to ±50bp (surprise hawkish shock)
BoJ exits negative rates; ends yield curve control framework
MPC authorises £75B Asset Purchase Facility; Bank Rate cut to 0.5%
APF expanded to £175B
APF expanded by £75B to £275B amid euro area crisis
Post-Brexit stimulus: £60B gilts + £10B corporate bonds; rate cut to 0.25%
MPC adds £200B to APF in emergency COVID response
Riksbank cuts repo rate to -0.1% and announces SEK 10B government bond purchases
Riksbank expands bond purchases by additional SEK 30B
Riksbank deepens NIRP to -0.5% and expands QE envelope further
Riksbank announces SEK 300B asset purchase framework in COVID response
SNB announces CHF foreign exchange purchases to prevent appreciation
SNB sets minimum EUR/CHF exchange rate of 1.20 (open-ended commitment)
SNB unexpectedly removes EUR/CHF floor; deepens negative rates to -0.75%
